reviews.title: GOOD ROOMS

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: the room was full of character and had a good comfy bed and a useful kitchenette for breakfast and snacks a nice change from a hotel.There is also a lovely conservatory and garden for guests to use. It is In a lovely area for walking and places of interest like Bakewell Matlock Chatsworth etc.The castle at Riber is very enchanting you cannot get to close as they are working on it but there is a good walk around the back of it with spectacular views of Matlock town.We would definitely return to stay at Riber apartments
reviews.title: amazing place to stay!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Booked this place as we are fed up keep getting crap breakfasts everywhere we go.The rooms are nice and clean and spacey and have a mini kitchen so you can have a lie in and then make your breakfast at your leisure. Its a lovely setting there cant really fault the place and has a large living room in the building if you want it too.AND TO ROUND IT OFF THE BEDS ARE REALLY COMFORTABLE TOO!!
reviews.title: a special weekend

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: total relaxation in rural surroundings, riber studio appartments are the perfect place to stay to escape the stresses of life. beautiful bedrooms, and the comfiest bed we have ever slept in and the little extras in each room make it a very special place to stay, perfect for a romantic break away, we will certainly be back and would highly recommend. very well ran, liked that we didnt see another person, felt like we had got the studios to ouselves even though there were other guests . cant wait to go back! thankyou!

reviews.title: A journey back in time

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Everything is included for your self catering needs. The bed was so comfortable, but very high!! A proper old fashioned 4 poster bed, so romantic and sumptuous.
reviews.title: Perfect Weekend !

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The bathroom was huge and of a very high standard, hot water on demand. everything was supplied for your own use right down to the shower gel.
reviews.title: I wish I could visit every weekend!

reviews.text: The owner's do send information on how to get there, which was very helpful, as the sat nav will take you up the narrowest, steepest mountain tracks!! The studio's are not too far out of Matlock, just a 10 minute drive.
reviews.title: Fantastic welcoming feeling!
Perfect!
reviews.text: Waiting for us was a bottle of wine and some sweeties, which was a lovely touch. All in all, despite the awful weather, we had a lovely break away from everything.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked these apartments last minute on laterooms.com and were really pleased we did. They are beautifully converted apartments in the old riber hall , next to the Imposing Riber Castle (you will never get lost as the castle can be seen from miles around!) Loved the 4 poster bed, Dressing gowns, welcome pack and helpful info in the aprtment. Also the communal garden, terrace and TV Lounge was a lovely feature. The only thing to be aware of is the extremely steep descent into Matlock/Ascent coming back, it certainly gets you fit! All in all we loved it
reviews.title: Lovely, great value place to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here as a couple looking for a getaway weekend not far from the Peak District and this was exactly what we found. Lovely clean room, bathroom and kitchenette. Nice grounds to use as you please, with some little tables and chairs in the garden which we used for a bottle of wine and game of cards on a balmy evening. Didn't see anybody at check-in or check-out but that was absolutely fine as we knew that would be the case, and location and arrival instructions were perfect. Came across some other guests briefly, who seemed as taken with the place as we were. Agree with a previous comment about the pillows - we too had to supplement the single pillow with cushions, so it would be a great addition to have two per person.
reviews.title: Lovely hidden gem

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My partner booked a night here as a suprise for my birthday - and it was absolutely perfect in every way! These are studio apartments, self catering and are in an extremely peaceful, tranquil setting surrounded by sprawling countryside and situated next to Riber Castle. We stayed in room 10 - which I highly recommend - definately worth asking for this room when booking, as seemed to be one of the best, with its own private doorway leading down from the bedroom onto immaculate lawns. The room itself was spacious with a huge beautiful four-poster bed, a table and two chairs with a lovely old gold gilt mirror hanging on the wall. The studio oozed charm and character with some areas in the rooms having exposed brick walls.
reviews.title: Tranquil Relaxing Getaway

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The bathroom was large and spacious with a shower, huge jacuzzi bath and his and hers sinks. All the facilities were spotlessly clean.
reviews.title: Great find!

reviews.text: There is a small kitchen area, complete with microwave, fridge, sink, toaster and kettle. This is only small with basic facilities, but perfectly ample for a weekend break where you just want to rustle up light bites.
